p: H9N2 viruses have been isolated from several African countries, the virus appears endemic in poultry in Egypt and has been repeatedly isolated from chickens in Libya and Tunisia [ 38, 42, 50, 51]. Additionally, since 2016 the virus has been isolated for the first time in countries across North and West Africa including Morocco, Burkina Faso, Ghana and Algeria as well as in East Africa in Uganda [ 17, 52, 53, 54, 55]. Morocco has subsequently undertaken an apparently successful mass poultry vaccination programme [ 52]. All viruses isolated from poultry in Africa have been of the G1 ‘Western’ sub-lineage, related to those circulating in the Middle East in Israel, Jordan, Lebanon, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.
